result.execSummary:
The defendant Tanya L. PIVONKA-DEWANE was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Heroin with intent to deliver (<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full-time employment/schooling in the capacity determined by the department.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Provide DNA sample.

timeConds.notes:
Nine (9) months up front, under the Huber Law including treatment.  
Three (3) months stayed, to be imposed upon the agent's discretion.

Judgment of Conviction Sentence Withheld, Probation Ordered.  Duplicate original delivered to DOC and Sheriff

NO CONTEST plea entered to the charge of possess heroin with intent to deliver. Convicted.
Sentencing is set for 032-6-15 at 9:00 a.m.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights.
Minutes.

Defendant in custody on bench warrant.  The matter is continued for a plea date on 02-20-15 at 3:30 p.m.  The $1,000.00 recognizance bond previously furnished is continued by the Court and the defendant is released from custody.
Bench warrant with service of officer thereon.
Notice to defendant.
Minutes.
Warrant served.

The matter was set for a plea hearing today.  About 1 1/2 hours ago, Attorney Kraft received a text from the defendant's roommate, from the defendant's phone, indicating that the defendant was having a seizure and was in and out of consciousness.  Attorney Kraft has no way to confirm this.
The Court authorizes a bench warrant but will hold signing the warrant until Friday awaiting medical documentation of what Attorney Kraft stated.
